verses.kjv: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
verses.web: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,
verses.ct: Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea during the reign of King Herod. Around that time, wise men from the east arrived in Jerusalem,

verses.kjv: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
verses.web: “Where is he who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”
verses.ct: asking, "Where is the one who has been born King of the Jews? We saw his star rise in the east and have come to worship him."

verses.kjv: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.web: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.ct: When King Herod heard this, he was deeply disturbed — and so was everyone in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
verses.web: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them where the Christ would be born.
verses.ct: He called together all the chief priests and scribes and demanded to know where the Christ was supposed to be born.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
verses.web: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,
verses.ct: They told him, "In Bethlehem of Judea, because the prophet wrote:

verses.kjv: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
verses.web: ‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: 'And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means the least among the rulers of Judah, for out of you will come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.'"

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
verses.web: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared.
verses.ct: Then Herod secretly summoned the wise men and pressed them for the exact time the star had appeared.

verses.kjv: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
verses.web: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said, “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”
verses.ct: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search carefully for the child. When you find him, report back to me so that I can go and worship him too."

verses.kjv: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
verses.web: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.
verses.ct: After hearing the king, they set out. And there it was — the star they had seen in the east went ahead of them until it stopped directly over the place where the child was.

verses.kjv: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
verses.web: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
verses.ct: When they saw the star standing still, they were overwhelmed with joy.

verses.kjv: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.web: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.ct: They went into the house and found the young child with his mother Mary. They knelt down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasure chests and presented him with gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

verses.kjv: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
verses.web: Being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.
verses.ct: God warned them in a dream not to go back to Herod, so they returned to their own country by a different route.

verses.kjv: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
verses.web: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”
verses.ct: After the wise men had left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, "Get up! Take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you it's safe, because Herod is going to search for the child and try to kill him."

verses.kjv: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
verses.web: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt,
verses.ct: So Joseph got up that very night, took the child and his mother, and left for Egypt.

verses.kjv: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
verses.web: and was there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
verses.ct: They stayed there until Herod died. This fulfilled what the Lord had spoken through the prophet: "Out of Egypt I called my son."

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
verses.web: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceedingly angry, and sent out, and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.
verses.ct: When Herod realized the wise men had outsmarted him, he flew into a rage. He ordered the execution of every boy 2 years old and under in Bethlehem and the surrounding area, based on the timing he had learned from the wise men.

verses.kjv: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,
verses.web: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,
verses.ct: This fulfilled what the prophet Jeremiah had spoken:

verses.kjv: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
verses.web: “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn’t be comforted, because they are no more.”
verses.ct: "A voice was heard in Ramah — weeping and deep mourning. Rachel crying for her children, refusing to be comforted, because they are no more."

verses.kjv: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.web: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,
verses.ct: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt

verses.kjv: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child’s life.
verses.web: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child’s life are dead.”
verses.ct: and said, "Get up, take the child and his mother, and go back to the land of Israel. The people who were trying to kill the child are dead."

verses.kjv: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.web: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.ct: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and returned to the land of Israel.

verses.kjv: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
verses.web: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee,
verses.ct: But when he learned that Archelaus was ruling over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to settle there. Warned by God in a dream, he headed instead to the region of Galilee,

verses.kjv: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
verses.web: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets that he will be called a Nazarene.
verses.ct: where he settled in a town called Nazareth. This fulfilled what the prophets had said: "He will be called a Nazarene."
